N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 124.2 - Right to representation and to remain silent

State Regulations
(a) The motorist may be represented by an
attorney or, in the administrative law judge's discretion, by any other person
the motorist chooses. Any person representing the motorist must conform to the
standards of conduct required of attorneys appearing before State courts, and
failure to conform to these standards will be grounds for declining to permit
his or her continued appearance in the proceeding. Wherever a notice is
required, notice to either the motorist or the motorist's representative shall
suffice as notice to both. (b) The
motorist shall be informed of the right to counsel and the right not to
testify. No negative inference will be drawn from the exercise of the
motorist's right not to testify. Notes
